0.title: Home
0.description: A collection of notes for everything we do and operate at Dwarves. This is where we keep our internal notes.

1.title: Home
1.description: A collection of notes for everything we do and operate at Dwarves. This is where we keep our internal notes.

3.title: Hybrid working at Dwarves
3.description: Dwarves HQ is in Saigon, but we proudly embrace a flexible hybrid working culture. The Foundation fully supports team members in choosing their ideal work environment. Whether you're local or abroad, you're always welcome to work remotely or visit Saigon and use the office as needed.

4.title: Evolutionary Database Design: Managing Change and Scaling with the System
4.description: As systems scale to meet growing demands, databases must evolve alongside them to maintain performance and integrity. This document explores best practices for managing database changes, maintaining knowledge, and ensuring smooth integration. Topics covered include knowledge sharing, repository structuring, continuous integration, and database refactoring, with real-world examples illustrating their application.

5.title: Frontend Report February 2025
5.description: Our February 2025 report covers what's new in frontend development - from React's move away from Create React App to Next.js improvements, browser compatibility updates, and cool new tools like React Scan. Get practical tips for better auth, faster websites, and making your sites work for everyone.

6.title: Micro Frontends Microservices For Frontend Development
6.description: Micro Frontends is an architectural style where independently deliverable frontend applications are composed into a greater whole.

7.title: Optimizing initial load time for a Trading Platform
7.description: Discover the technical strategies behind optimizing a Binance trading platform, reducing initial load times to under 1 second for enhanced trader productivity.

8.title: Life at Dwarves
8.description: We build this company like we build a product. There are roadmaps for growth; there are phases; there are iterations. There might also be bugs, places where the company crashes because of bad organizational design, or cultural oversights.

9.title: Talks and Takeaways from the Scene: Part 1
9.description: Talks and Takeaways from the Scene Part 1

10.title: Building a complete tech system for small Vietnamese hotels
10.description: We helped Aharooms create a suite of digital tools that enables small hotels in Vietnam to improve operations, increase bookings, and boost revenue, especially during the challenging COVID-19 period when adaptation was crucial.

11.title: Redesigning BHD Cinema's ticket booking app for a better experience
11.description: We helped BHD Cinema transform their outdated mobile app into an intuitive platform that allows customers to easily browse movies, book tickets online, and enjoy a seamless cinema experience, turning movie-goers into loyal BHD fans.

12.title: Building a powerful crypto trading dashboard for professionals
12.description: We built Hedge Foundation, a powerful crypto trading dashboard that helps professional traders manage multiple accounts, track positions, and automate order execution in real-time across exchanges.

13.title: Kafi: Making stock trading easier for everyone
13.description: We helped Kafi Securities rebuild their stock trading app to work better for both beginners and experienced traders, making investing more accessible for everyone.

14.title: Building a central hub for food and beverage businesses in Singapore
14.description: We helped Momos, a pre-seed startup in Singapore, build their first MVP, a centralized data hub that simplifies online operations for food and beverage businesses through third-party integrations and data analytics.

15.title: Building a community platform for Vietnamese Entrepreneurs
15.description: We helped create a digital hub where Vietnamese startup founders can connect, share knowledge, and access resources to grow their businesses.

16.title: Weekly Consulting Snapshot #8: R1 1776 Goes Open-Source, Cardex Gets Hacked, and Grok-3 Debuts
16.description: R1 1776 Goes Open-Source, Cardex Gets Hacked, and Grok-3 Debuts

17.title: Weekly Consulting Snapshot #9: Bybit Loses $1.5B in Hack, Claude 3.7 Sonnet Drops, and OpenArt Designs Characters
17.description: Bybit Loses $1.5B in Hack, Claude 3.7 Sonnet Drops, and OpenArt Designs Characters

18.title: Weekly Consulting Snapshot #3: AI’s Ubiquity at CES, Wall Street’s AI Boom, and Blockchain Innovations
18.description: Explore the impact of AI at CES 2025, Wall Street's AI-driven surge, and the fusion of blockchain and AI in emerging projects.

19.title: What's New in July 2021
19.description: Each month, we release a recap noting all the significant changes with our company and our team. July 2021 we will move toward blockchain industry and prepare for performance review in August.

20.title: 2022 In Review
20.description: Successfully went through 2022, a year that we might say -  a new record team reached highest growth record, kickstarted community engagement, home, compliance training & individual development are speeding up, and a whole new place to call Dwarves.

21.title: What's New in January 2022
21.description: Each month, we release a recap noting all the significant changes with our company and our team. January 2022 will go over performance review and our growth on projects, new year highlights.

22.title: 2024 In Review
22.description: Closing another milestone with 2024, it has been a year of building and rebuilding ,  strengthening what works, fixing what doesn’t, and uncovering new paths along the way. Every milestone reached this year carries the marks of teamwork and persistence.

23.title: Navigating changes
23.description: The last tech cycle is ending, and we're already in the new normal. We are not in the best shape to compete with certain competitors, especially with a new market meta emerging. We are now in a future of new automation paradigms via AI and assets are moving on-chain.

24.title: What's New in August 2024
24.description: Each month, we release a recap highlighting key updates and progress within our team and community. August updates highlight AI tools, enhanced community discussions, the sum command upgrade, Go enterprise MOC insights, and earning dfg tokens through contributions.

25.title: What's New in November 2024
25.description: In November, we sharpened our focus with advancements in platform engineering, introduced streamlined service packages, elevated ICY rewards for impactful contributions, and embraced key insights from market shifts, all building momentum as we gear up for our Penang retreat.

26.title: What's New in September 2024
26.description: Each month, we roll out a recap of our team and community's strides forward. September's updates spotlight the AI Club launch, rewards for our sharing culture, hybrid work check-ins, reporting tech trends in forward engineering, and our Mid-Autumn celebration.

27.title: Culture Test
27.description: Here's the culture test created during the market challenges of late 2024. It is designed to highlight and reinforce the cultural values at Dwarves Foundation. It’s a chance to reflect, share, and show how you fit into our team.

28.title: Weekly Digest #10: From lean to learner
28.description: Double digits, I can't believe we've reached our 10th digest! It's been quite a journey putting together each edition and a blast creating these for you. When we talk about memo, we're highlighting an essential part of our learning culture. We’ve just noted a few updates for the cycle ahead. Now, let's dive into this round-up.

29.title: Weekly Digest #11: Come grow with us
29.description: Things are always cooking on our Discord. So grab a virtual seat at our table, pour yourself a cup of something tasty, and read the digest. If you're reading this, why not pop into the woodland and say hello? We'd love to meet you.

30.title: Weekly Digest #13: More than lines of code
30.description: Welcome to this week's edition of our roundup, where we highlight the moments that make us more than just lines of code. This week, we're jet-setting around the world with our team's summer adventures, introducing new memo features, cheering for a beloved teammate's new chapter in the US, and celebrating new born. From beachside workspaces to anime figurine collections, we've got it all.

31.title: Weekly Digest #14: Embracing hybrid work - the best of both worlds
31.description: Discover how Dwarves embraces hybrid working, blending flexibility with in-person connections. Learn how our office space fosters productivity, learning, and real collaboration, even if it’s just for a day or two a week.

32.title: Weekly Digest #15: New year Gathering: Sharing Tết, starting strong
32.description: Tết break came to an end, and the Dwarves team reunited to share stories, reconnect, and kick off the Year of the Snake in style. We brought it all back to Discord, along with a little SOL & ICY drop to start the year right.

33.title: Weekly Digest #6: Come for the conversation, stay for the culture
33.description: Hi, it’s @innno again. Summer is almost here. But don't worry, this update is all about making your day more comfortable. Now, onto this week’s updates.

34.title: Weekly Digest #9: A little more speed for summer
34.description: How quickly the first half of the year speeds up before it slows down. It’s really the second half of 2024 already. Time flies when you're having a blast. Get ready to rewind and relive some of the awesome highlights from the last week, get pumped for the epic things we'll do together before this year is over.

35.title: Forward Engineering 2022
35.description: We want to demonstrate and encourage individual and organizational learning, where both gaining and sharing knowledge is prioritized, valued, and rewarded. Learning is an ongoing process that never ends in our fast-moving industry.

36.title: Forward Engineering Quarter 3, 2024
36.description: In Q3/2024 Forward Engineering, we explore new tech stacks, engineering excellence, and key trends from the tech market over the past three months, with a focus on AI. Learn about tools like Dify, LangGraph, RAG, and more as we share our experiments and insights. Whether you’re interested in AI-driven workflows or tech market trends like the surge in AI startups and hiring demand.

37.title: Dwarves Tech Radar Volume 01
37.description: For this edition, the theme is to get the whole team used to the concept of a central knowledge base, every study to expand our view to the tech scene counts. The design team also has a place to contribute and discuss their practices.

38.title: Build your knowledge base
38.description: In an age where Large Language Models like ChatGPT offer instant access to a universe of information, it raises the question, does our own personal knowledge base still hold any value, and is building a personal knowledge base still a legitimate thing to do?

39.title: Collaboration Guideline
39.description: guidelines for project collaboraton DF and Client

40.title: Fixed Budget Scope Controlled
40.description: Fixed-Budget, Scope-Controlled (FBSC) is applied at Atomic Object.

41.title: Pricing model: Bill by hours
41.description: A new hourly billing model is introduced to ensure fair compensation for effort, flexibility in project scope, control over additional work, and transparency with clients.

42.title: Lean Canvas
42.description: Lean Canvas is an adaptation of Business Model Canvas by Alexander Osterwalder which Ash Maurya created in the Lean Startup spirit (Fast, Concise and Effective startup). Lean Canvas promises an actionable and entrepreneur-focused business plan. It focuses on problems, solutions, key metrics, and competitive advantages.

43.title: Low-fidelity prototype: UI Design
43.description: Design systems enable teams to build better products faster by making design reusable, reusability makes scale possible.

44.title: Onboarding
44.description: What we have to do when a new employee come to our team.

45.title: Offer Letter
45.description: The email template is to annouce about new employment.

46.title: Hiring Approach
46.description: Hire people who tell us what to do, not the other way around.

47.title: How People Matter Should Work
47.description: A philosophical exploration of authentic employee engagement in software companies, focusing on individual contributions, unconventional hiring practices, knowledge sharing culture, and intrinsic motivation rather than superficial happiness metrics.

48.title: How to conduct delivery reports
48.description: How we conduct insightful delivery reports that ensure transparency, improve team performance, and enhance client relationships

49.title: How we do effective planning and reporting
49.description: How we do effective planning and reporting at Dwarves

50.title: OGIF - Oh God It's Friday
50.description: I would like to introduce to you our new initiative called **OGIF** ,  Oh God It's Friday. Moving forward, our Friday Showcase will have a broader range of topics to discuss and share.

51.title: Our Policy For Remote Working
51.description: Some useful practices we adopted to keep the remote working system goes smoothly. This policy is written in the context of our current company setup.

52.title: Setup email template in Gmail
52.description: How to setup template for email in Gmail

53.title: How to swap ICY to BTC
53.description: A friendly guide to converting your ICY tokens to Bitcoin (BTC) using our platform. We'll walk you through the process step by step, from wallet setup to transaction monitoring.

54.title: How much is your ICY worth
54.description: Learn how ICY's value has evolved from a fixed USDC-backed model to a dynamic Bitcoin-backed system. We'll explain what this means for your holdings and how to track your ICY's value.

55.title: Memo Handbook
55.description: Memo is where we share everything we learn, build, and think about product craftsmanship, engineering, and our culture. It's our commitment to learning in public.

56.title: Compliance
56.description: Our commitment to ethical standards and compliance

57.title: Borrowing & requesting company assets
57.description: How to borrow company assets like books or devices, or request new ones. Simple steps for getting the gear you need.

58.title: Office check-in process for earning ICY
58.description: A guide on how to check in at the office and claim ICY token rewards.

59.title: Email Communication and Use
59.description: We use email as our formal tool for both internal and external communication. Every email is utilized for a specific field, which comes along with different instructions.

60.title: Submit a leave request
60.description: A consistent on leave process prevents a company from being accidentally disrupted when an employee request to be absent.

61.title: Understanding your NDA & other agreements
61.description: A guide to the Non-Disclosure, Non-Solicitation, and IP agreements you signed when joining Dwarves.

62.title: Our second brain
62.description: This page explains our knowledge base, which is basically our team's shared brain where we keep important stuff. Using it helps us work smarter together and makes sure we don't lose good ideas or lessons learned.

63.title: Navigate changes
63.description: How we deal with technology changes

64.title: What we value
64.description: Our core values guide our strategies and individual actions so that we create a company whose character is as radical as our work.

65.title: 💠 df protocol, $icy and $dfg
65.description: Here's our draft internal map/v0 for 🧊 $icy play, based on our current activities at this borderless software firm...

66.title: $icy in 2024
66.description: Quick recap about $icy progress and what's next in 2024.

67.title: Dwarves Memo
67.description: Learned by engineers. Experimented by engineers. Experienced by engineers. Written by Dwarves for product craftsmen.

68.title: How to set up crypto wallet to withdraw ICY
68.description: To withdraw ICY to Vietnam Bank or other fiat, you need set up 2 types of wallet in advance. This guide will show you how to setup crypto wallet.

69.title: How to withdraw ICY
69.description: This guide show how to swap ICY to fiat.

70.title: Quantization for large language models
70.description: As large language models (LLMs) continue to evolve, their parameter counts grow exponentially, with some models reaching trillions of parameters. This exponential growth presents significant challenges for deployment on edge devices and in resource-constrained environments due to extensive memory and computational requirements. Quantization emerges as a crucial technique to reduce model footprint while preserving acceptable performance.

71.title: Frontend Report March 2025
71.description: March 2025 brings critical frontend updates! Learn about the Next.js security exploit you must patch nows. Explore TypeScript's upcoming 10x speed boost with Corsa, React Router's game-changing middleware, and why prefetching can surprisingly slow down your site. Plus: CSS functions are finally here, new in Chrome 133, Node.js is dropping Corepack, and TanStack Start finds an official deployment home!

72.title: Secure and transparent uptime monitoring with Upptime and GitHub secrets
72.description: Discover how Dwarves Foundation uses Upptime and GitHub Actions for transparent public uptime monitoring while securely keeping tabs on internal services.

73.title: Labs Team
73.description: This is our Labs team homepage, where we list out the latest advances in our engineering team, our publications, events & workshops, as well as frequently asked questions on who and what team labs are.

74.title: Culture Handbook
74.description: Keep learning and growing. We started this team out of software practice advancement.

75.title: How we hire
75.description: Hiring means we need help. We only hire people who tell us what to do, not the other way around. We always look for long-term teammates that why we want to ensure the new hire is a value fit and culture fit.

76.title: Apprentice Program
76.description: Apprenticeship is a six-month earn-and-learn training program; it's a way to learn about being a professional software developer.

77.title: Dwarves Foundation Apprenticeship: Batch Of 2022
77.description: It’s our second attempt rolling out this program. But the motivation stays the same: Accelerating someone’s current software development skillset.

78.title: QA Engineer
78.description: As an engineer at Dwarves, you will be working closely with a team of talented, kind people and working directly with our clients. There is a lot of freedom to contribute to the quality of the project and improve, or prove yourself

79.title: Full-Stack Engineer
79.description: We are looking for a Full-Stack Engineer who is passionate about building scalable, secure, and efficient web applications. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of both frontend and backend technologies, and the ability to work across the entire stack.

80.title: Careers
80.description: We want people who are passionate about software, talented at what they do, and respect craftsmanship. People who understand precisely what goes into their codes, and have no problem explaining it.We want people who are calm, kind, and responsible. People who take the reign, run the show instead of waiting to be told what to do.

81.title: Growth
81.description: At Dwarves, you will be working closely with a team of talented, kind people and working directly with our clients. There is a lot of freedom to contribute to the quality of the project and improve, or prove yourself

82.title: OGIF Office Hours #20 - Golang weekly, Modeling dynamic object properties, Devbox demo, LLM tracing, Cursor AI editor
82.description: Our latest OGIF session covers key topics such as Go 1.23 and the introduction of Go Notebook, dynamic object modeling inspired by Notion, advanced LLM tracing techniques, Devbox demo and a hands-on look at the Cursor AI code editor. By sharing weekly topics chosen through tags, we foster a collaborative learning environment for our community to grow.

83.title: OGIF Office Hours #22 - Hybrid working, Tech market report, Go commentary weekly, AI demo for Go weekly content production.
83.description: In OGIF 22, we talked about Devbox progress, GReader updates, and using libre chat for artifact management. We also cover optimizing AI system prompts, Go commentary, and key market trends. Plus, we discuss how hybrid work can boost team collaboration and productivity. It’s all about practical tips and knowledge sharing to keep everyone up to speed.

84.title: OGIF Office Hours #23 - Go weekly, Frontend report, Hybrid working support, and AI mixture agent
84.description: In OGIF Office Hour 23 covered a variety of topics, including updates on Golang Weekly and its use in enterprise environments, comparing Go with Java and C++. The session explored the latest trends in React 19 AC, Next.js, and CSS Grid, alongside new form-building tools. Additionally, the team discussed productivity enhancements using AI-driven solutions like mixture agents, while introducing upcoming tests and hybrid work support.

85.title: OGIF Office Hours #24 - Go weekly, AI-Driven Workflows, Holistic Team AI Demo, and Figma to UI Component with Claude
85.description: In our OGIF office hour 24 covers AI-driven workflows with Tom, a demo with the Holistic team, and Figma integration with Claude for UI components and Go commentary. Highlights include Agent Zero's data automation capabilities, Figma-to-code conversion, and the benefits of in-office collaboration for efficient knowledge transfer and AI/ML learning.

86.title: OGIF Office Hours #25 - Team & Community updates, Hybrid culture, Product design commentary, AI Tooling Insights, Golang weekly
86.description: OGIF Office Hours 25 covers the latest insights on hybrid work culture, AI-driven tooling and workflows, Golang compiler optimizations, and AI-enhanced design strategies. Explore discussions on AR/VR trends, voice user interfaces, AI tools for UI/UX, predictive programming, and team demos showcasing AI integrations and Golang performance tweaks.

87.title: OGIF Office Hours #26 - Product Design Commentary, Go Weekly, Trading App Case Study, Chatbot Evaluations, and Announcement for Essay Assignments
87.description: In this Office Hours, Nam Bui shared product design insights on the Sparkle icon in AI and onboarding, Phat covered Go tools Prep and War Zero, and Hoang discussed chatbot evaluations. Anh presented a case study on AI-driven user research for Kafi. Management announced AI essay assignments tied to the year-end trip and performance reviews.

88.title: OGIF Office Hours #27 - Go Weekly, Frontend Report Sep, UX Guide to Prompt with AI, Computing the Union of Two Finite Automata
88.description: In OGIF office hour 27, covering presentations on UX Guide to Prompt with AI, computing the union of finite automata, and other topics including Go Weekly and Frontend Report for September.

documents.title: Lean Canvas
documents.description: Lean Canvas is an adaptation of Business Model Canvas by Alexander Osterwalder which Ash Maurya created in the Lean Startup spirit (Fast, Concise and Effective startup). Lean Canvas promises an actionable and entrepreneur-focused business plan. It focuses on problems, solutions, key metrics, and competitive advantages.

documents.description: A philosophical exploration of authentic employee engagement in software companies, focusing on individual contributions, unconventional hiring practices, knowledge sharing culture, and intrinsic motivation rather than superficial happiness metrics.

documents.description: A friendly guide to converting your ICY tokens to Bitcoin (BTC) using our platform. We'll walk you through the process step by step, from wallet setup to transaction monitoring.

documents.title: How much is your ICY worth
documents.description: Learn how ICY's value has evolved from a fixed USDC-backed model to a dynamic Bitcoin-backed system. We'll explain what this means for your holdings and how to track your ICY's value.

documents.title: Quantization for large language models
documents.description: As large language models (LLMs) continue to evolve, their parameter counts grow exponentially, with some models reaching trillions of parameters. This exponential growth presents significant challenges for deployment on edge devices and in resource-constrained environments due to extensive memory and computational requirements. Quantization emerges as a crucial technique to reduce model footprint while preserving acceptable performance.

documents.title: Frontend Report March 2025
documents.description: March 2025 brings critical frontend updates! Learn about the Next.js security exploit you must patch nows. Explore TypeScript's upcoming 10x speed boost with Corsa, React Router's game-changing middleware, and why prefetching can surprisingly slow down your site. Plus: CSS functions are finally here, new in Chrome 133, Node.js is dropping Corepack, and TanStack Start finds an official deployment home!

documents.title: Secure and transparent uptime monitoring with Upptime and GitHub secrets
documents.description: Discover how Dwarves Foundation uses Upptime and GitHub Actions for transparent public uptime monitoring while securely keeping tabs on internal services.

documents.title: Labs Team
documents.description: This is our Labs team homepage, where we list out the latest advances in our engineering team, our publications, events & workshops, as well as frequently asked questions on who and what team labs are.

documents.description: Keep learning and growing. We started this team out of software practice advancement.

documents.title: How we hire
documents.description: Hiring means we need help. We only hire people who tell us what to do, not the other way around. We always look for long-term teammates that why we want to ensure the new hire is a value fit and culture fit.

documents.title: Apprentice Program
documents.description: Apprenticeship is a six-month earn-and-learn training program; it's a way to learn about being a professional software developer.

documents.description: It’s our second attempt rolling out this program. But the motivation stays the same: Accelerating someone’s current software development skillset.

documents.title: QA Engineer
documents.description: As an engineer at Dwarves, you will be working closely with a team of talented, kind people and working directly with our clients. There is a lot of freedom to contribute to the quality of the project and improve, or prove yourself

documents.title: Full-Stack Engineer
documents.description: We are looking for a Full-Stack Engineer who is passionate about building scalable, secure, and efficient web applications. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of both frontend and backend technologies, and the ability to work across the entire stack.

documents.title: Careers
documents.description: We want people who are passionate about software, talented at what they do, and respect craftsmanship. People who understand precisely what goes into their codes, and have no problem explaining it.We want people who are calm, kind, and responsible. People who take the reign, run the show instead of waiting to be told what to do.

documents.title: Growth
documents.description: At Dwarves, you will be working closely with a team of talented, kind people and working directly with our clients. There is a lot of freedom to contribute to the quality of the project and improve, or prove yourself

documents.title: OGIF Office Hours #20 - Golang weekly, Modeling dynamic object properties, Devbox demo, LLM tracing, Cursor AI editor
documents.description: Our latest OGIF session covers key topics such as Go 1.23 and the introduction of Go Notebook, dynamic object modeling inspired by Notion, advanced LLM tracing techniques, Devbox demo and a hands-on look at the Cursor AI code editor. By sharing weekly topics chosen through tags, we foster a collaborative learning environment for our community to grow.

documents.title: OGIF Office Hours #22 - Hybrid working, Tech market report, Go commentary weekly, AI demo for Go weekly content production.
documents.description: In OGIF 22, we talked about Devbox progress, GReader updates, and using libre chat for artifact management. We also cover optimizing AI system prompts, Go commentary, and key market trends. Plus, we discuss how hybrid work can boost team collaboration and productivity. It’s all about practical tips and knowledge sharing to keep everyone up to speed.

documents.title: OGIF Office Hours #23 - Go weekly, Frontend report, Hybrid working support, and AI mixture agent
documents.description: In OGIF Office Hour 23 covered a variety of topics, including updates on Golang Weekly and its use in enterprise environments, comparing Go with Java and C++. The session explored the latest trends in React 19 AC, Next.js, and CSS Grid, alongside new form-building tools. Additionally, the team discussed productivity enhancements using AI-driven solutions like mixture agents, while introducing upcoming tests and hybrid work support.

documents.title: OGIF Office Hours #24 - Go weekly, AI-Driven Workflows, Holistic Team AI Demo, and Figma to UI Component with Claude
documents.description: In our OGIF office hour 24 covers AI-driven workflows with Tom, a demo with the Holistic team, and Figma integration with Claude for UI components and Go commentary. Highlights include Agent Zero's data automation capabilities, Figma-to-code conversion, and the benefits of in-office collaboration for efficient knowledge transfer and AI/ML learning.

documents.title: OGIF Office Hours #25 - Team & Community updates, Hybrid culture, Product design commentary, AI Tooling Insights, Golang weekly
documents.description: OGIF Office Hours 25 covers the latest insights on hybrid work culture, AI-driven tooling and workflows, Golang compiler optimizations, and AI-enhanced design strategies. Explore discussions on AR/VR trends, voice user interfaces, AI tools for UI/UX, predictive programming, and team demos showcasing AI integrations and Golang performance tweaks.

documents.title: OGIF Office Hours #26 - Product Design Commentary, Go Weekly, Trading App Case Study, Chatbot Evaluations, and Announcement for Essay Assignments
documents.description: In this Office Hours, Nam Bui shared product design insights on the Sparkle icon in AI and onboarding, Phat covered Go tools Prep and War Zero, and Hoang discussed chatbot evaluations. Anh presented a case study on AI-driven user research for Kafi. Management announced AI essay assignments tied to the year-end trip and performance reviews.

documents.title: OGIF Office Hours #27 - Go Weekly, Frontend Report Sep, UX Guide to Prompt with AI, Computing the Union of Two Finite Automata
documents.description: In OGIF office hour 27, covering presentations on UX Guide to Prompt with AI, computing the union of finite automata, and other topics including Go Weekly and Frontend Report for September.
